@graph.description: Earthy mushrooms are the savory stars of this creamy, pungent, satisfying Hungarian mushroom soup.
@graph.headline: Hungarian Mushroom Soup
@graph.keywords: hungarian mushroom soup,    fall, winter, vegetarian, 30-minute-meals, one-pot-meals
@graph.name: Hungarian Mushroom Soup

recipeInstructions.text: In a heavy pot or Dutch oven, sauté the onions and mushrooms in butter over medium heat until onions are soft and translucent, about 15 minutes
Add the dill, thyme, paprika, broth, soy sauce and white wine
Bring the soup to a simmer and cook until the liquid reduces by half
Meanwhile, in a small bowl, whisk the flour into the milk until smooth
Add the flour-milk mixture to the soup and cook until the soup begins to thicken, about 10 more minutes.	Turn the heat down to low and slowly stir in the sour cream and lemon juice

Garnish the soup with parsley and serve hot.
**Yields 5 cups of soup
If you want to serve it to four people as a main dish, we recommend doubling the recipe

review.reviewBody: Oh. My. Goodness.  This is such an incredibly delicious--and absolutely soul-satisfying--recipe.  Soooo easy to make, and the aromas of the cooking soup filled the house. (It doubled beautifully.) Truly a comfort food type of recipe, evoking memories of a time when 3 generations of us ended up living together (in a way-too-small family home) after the death of our Mother. We may have been sad sometimes but did we ever eat well, and enjoy sitting down--all 8 of us--at the old oak table.  Thanks for this particular recipe, Ladies!
One of the best soups I’ve ever made or tried. Creamy, earthy and delicious. I can’t wait to make some more.
I made this soup tonight, it was actually the second time! My husband and I love this soup so much, we are big mushroom fans! Tonight I used 1lb of cremini and 1/2 lb Shitaki, so delicious!

AMAZING recipe!!  We came into a bagful of fresh oyster mushrooms and found your recipe. O...M...G!  Thank you! My husband can't tolerate onions so I substituted onion powder and as I was out of white wine, I subbed some cooking sherry.  Can't imagine a better soup, especially with a crusty baguette. We've printed the recipe and put it in the book!

Wonderful recipe, have made a couple of times. Omitted the flour and sourcream because of carb and fat content. Made with ingredients from sweet potato, carrot, mushroom soup and seasonings from this recipe, which I like the taste better. Added 1 cup white wine, 1 box chicken broth low sodium, 1 can coconut milk, 1 pkg onion soup mix, and 1 tbsp worchestutire? Sauce, 1 small can sliced mushrooms for flavor. Husband liked the flavors and broth. Would like it thicker, but he likes more broth:) A keeper for winters cold days, very delicious

This recipe is definitely a great base. However; I always find that I need WAY more soy sauce than what's in this recipe. Additionally, I like to caramelize one large onion ahead of time and mix them into the soup at the end. You cannot caramelize the onions the normal way due to the liquid that comes out of the mushrooms. I also add cayenne pepper to give it a wonderful kick at the end! Trust me on this! It turns out perfect, especially if you add a little more acid at the end with a splash of balsamic and a splash of worcestershire to bring it all together.
I made this with foraged oyster mushrooms and chanterelles. I was out of dill but added some garlic and leftover pork roast. Amazing.
Lovely soup! I added extra mushrooms (baby Bella and Cremini). The only thing I would omit next time is the lemon juice.
This is the BEST mushroom soup ever! Thank you!

Hands down the best mushroom soup I have ever made. Thank you so much for this recipe! I really liked the flavor the wine added and followed the recipe exactly, other than using fresh chanterelle mushrooms found locally. It heats up nicely for leftovers as well.
